cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas–Louisiana Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the Texas/Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Little Cayman and Cayman Brac; several Cuban provinces; Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West; Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Tropical Storm Warning in effect for those locations
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-western Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi and adjacent inland areas
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: SHREVEPORT LA (closest point listed in probability table – still hundreds of miles south-west of Ottawa)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only breezy conditions (below 34 kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – Ottawa Port District is far inland along the Illinois River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain late Friday–Saturday, possibly causing minor river rises.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential for localized river flooding along the Illinois River due to upstream heavy rainfall in the Mississippi Valley.
